result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis E. Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fines and costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Restitution is to be held open for 60 days, pending an appropriate request in writing with Court Commissioner Worzalla to schedule a restitution hearing. This is to be paid first, before being discharged from probation.***07-06-16 Zero restitution ordered***
Maintain absolute sobriety and comply with any necessary/appropriate counseling deemed necessary by the agent.

timeConds.notes:
May be transferred to Burnett County if they will accept Defendant.
Eligible for electronic home monitoring. Must serve 10 days in jail before becoming eligible for electronic home monitoring or huber.
Eligible for huber.
60 days to report.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Schmidt
(zero restitution added to JOC)
Letter from Atty Schmidt dated 06-16-16, Response letter from FCC
("Amended" not listed on form)

Defendant Travis E. Elliott in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:13 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Court has a Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

State has filed an amended information, amending information to three counts.
Defendant will plead to all 3 counts. 

State files a restitution summary.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated, will be arguing length of jail and will be requesting a restution hearing.

Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading and will enter pleas of NO CONTEST.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3.

Restitution hearing will be scheduled with the court commissioner.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty - amended
Count 2: Found Guilty - amended
Count 3: Found Guilty - amended

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for  a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Maintain absolute sobriety and comply with any necessary/appropriate counseling deemed necessary by the agent
Restitution is to be held open for 60 days, pending an appropriate request in writing with Court Commissioner Worzalla to schedule a restitution hearing. This is to be paid first, before being discharged from probation.
Jail sentence for a period of 6 Months
May be transferred to Burnett County if they will accept Defendant
Eligible for electronic home monitoring. Must serve 10 days in jail before becoming eligible for electronic home monitoring or huber.
Eligible for huber
60 days to report

Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for  a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for  a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs

Atty Molepske clarifies regarding electronic monitor.

Defendant Travis E. Elliott in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
